intro: Trichostema spirale, commonly known as spiral bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant has opposite, linear leaves and produces small, spirally arranged flower clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats. Trichostema spirale is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
